description: Variation of condition 1(approved plans) of planning permission 2019/2588 dated 09/09/2019 for excavation for basement extension underneath the garden to provide a playroom with two skylights. Alterations to the rear including a glass enclosed stairwell allowing internal access, variation to enlarge rear glazed stair enclosure at ground floor level.
decision_conditions:
<p>The development shall continue with&nbsp; detailed specification and a drainage layout&nbsp; approved under application ref:&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">2020/2144 consisting of</span>&nbsp;at least one suitable sustainable drainage systems (i.e. water butt,
raingarden, bioretention planter box, living roof (substrate depth of 80-150mm
excluding the vegetative mat), permeable paving etc.) submitted to,
and approved by the LPA, in consultation with the SuDS officer.&nbsp;</p><p>REASON: To prevent localised flooding as a result of the approved works.<br></p>

<p>The development shall continue with the approved scheme under application reference: 2020/2076 (08/09/2020) for the provision and implementation of flood resilient and
resistant construction details and measures for the basement against surface
water flood risk shall submitted to and agreed, in writing with the LPA in
consultation with the LLFA prior to the construction of the measures. The
scheme shall continue to be carried out in its entirety before the basement is occupied
and; constructed and completed in accordance with the approved plans in line
with BS 8102:2009 code of practice for "protection of below ground structures
against water from the ground" and BS 8582:2013 code of practice for "surface
water management for development sites" where applicable.</p><p>REASON: To prevent localised flooding as a result of the approved works.<br></p>

<p>The development shall continue in accordance with details&nbsp; submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority under application reference&nbsp;2020/2144 (15/09/2020) requiring&nbsp;vehicle
cleansing facilities to prevent mud being deposited onto the public highway
during construction works shall be provided on site in accordance with details
to be first submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning
Authority prior to first commencement. The approved facilities shall be retained thereafter and used at
relevant entrances to the site throughout the duration of construction works. If
mud or other debris originating from the site is deposited in the public
highway, all on-site operations shall cease until it has been removed. The
submission will provide;
a) A plan showing where vehicles will be parked within the site to be
inspected for mud and debris and cleaned if required. The plan should show
where construction traffic will access and exit the site from the public
highway.
b) A description of how the parking area will be surfaced, drained and
cleaned to prevent mud, debris and muddy water being tracked onto the public
highway;
c) A description of how vehicles will be checked before leaving the site - this
applies to the vehicle wheels, the underside of vehicles, mud flaps and wheel
arches.
d) A description of how vehicles will be cleaned.
e) A description of how dirty/ muddy water be dealt with after being washing
off the vehicles.
f) A description of any contingency plan to be used in the event of a breakdown of the wheel washing arrangements.</p><p>Reason: In the interests of
highway safety and the amenity of the surrounding area<br></p>

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

<p>The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than three years from the date of the original permission 2019/2588 dated 09/09/2019.</p><p>REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 91(1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended.</p><p>
</p>

<p>All new external finishes in respect of all the works hereby approved (and
any other incidental works to be carried out in this connection) shall match the
existing building in respect of materials used, detailed execution and finished
appearance.
</p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is
satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the
area.<br></p>

The proposed glazing of the enclosure on the north elevation facing no.24 shall be obscured glazed and fixed shut. 


REASON: To safeguard against loss of privacy amenity impacts through overlooking.

<p>In the event that groundwater is encountered during excavation, a
groundwater mitigation plan should be submitted to the LPA for approval to
ensure that flood mitigation measures are implemented.
</p><p>REASON: To prevent localised flooding as a result of the approved works.<br></p>
